unnormalised: **Load Shedding: When the Lights Go Out in Lucknow (and Everywhere Else!)**
normalised: Load shedding, or planned power outages, is essentially a controlled measure to prevent the entire electricity grid from collapsing under heavy demand. Think of it like this: imagine a chappati maker trying to feed a whole wedding party – at some point, he’s gotta slow down to keep from burning everything, right? Same principle.

normalised: The thing is, load shedding isn't just a minor inconvenience. It affects everything. Businesses lose productivity, students can't study, hospitals can face critical equipment failures (thankfully, they usually have backup generators). It can even lead to increased crime rates in some areas. Remember that neighborhood "chowkidar" relying on streetlights? Yeah, him too.
